overview:
A VCpreneur from Jordan, (an entrepreneur in the venture capital industry), focusing on investing in Internet and Mobile ventures.

Head of Investments at N2V, the most active Internet holding company in Arabia, managing the holdingâ€™s Investments in early stage web companies in the MENA region.

Board member and advisor in several web and mobile web startups in Dubai, Riyadh, Amman and Cairo

Member of the VC Task Force at the MENA Private Equity Association

Attended the Private Equity and Venture Capital training workshop at Harvard Business School

Judge at MIT Arab Business Plan competition, Startup Weekend Amman, ArabNet Cairo Startup Demo, and Zajil Award for Arab Web Startups.

Mentor at Queen Rania National Entrepreneurship Competition (QRNEC), Seed Startup Accelerator, iPark Incubator in Jordan, and in several Startup Weekend Bootcamps in the Middle East region.

Won the MIT Arab Business Plan competition in 2009, and Queen Rania National Entrepreneurship Competition (QRNEC) 2006.

Was known as the youngest Arab Venture Capitalist when I first started my venture capital career at the age of 28, and the first Arab VC Blogger on: http://AhmadTakatkah.com

Holds an MBA from New York Institute of Technology (NYIT), a B.Sc. degree in electronics engineering from Princess Sumaya University of Technology (PUST).
